alert.note: Alert for Cimarron (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 19 at 12:34PM CST until January 21 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate to heavy snow in the northwest Oklahoma Panhandle. Likely snow amounts of 1 to 3 inches, with the higher end potential being in the 4 to 6 inch range. Winds could also gust as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Cimarron County. * WHEN...From Friday evening through Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions and reduced visibility from snow and blowing snow. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...If higher amounts occur, we could see snow rates in the 1 to 2 inch per hour range, which would make travel very difficult as well as road conditions would quickly deteriorate.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. Persons should consider delaying all travel. If travel is absolutely necessary, drive with extreme caution. Consider taking a winter storm kit along with you, including such items as tire chains, booster cables, flashlight, shovel, blankets and extra clothing. Also take water, a first aid kit, and anything else that would help you survive in case you become stranded.
